Description: Lower body and foot sherd of Corinthian black-glazed pottery kotyle; glaze fired red. Interior glazed; exterior: wide black band above frieze of thin rays above junction with glazed ring foot; underside: concentric circles in centre of foot; foot glazed. Graffito under foot.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see British Museum 1886,0401.646 and Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA193.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.249) (phase 3)
